episodes.title: Epstein files continue to reveal more
episodes.description:
A group of United Nations Independent Human Rights experts says the Epstein Files contain disturbing and credible evidence of systematic and large-scale sexual abuse, trafficking and exploitation of women and girls that could amount to crimes against humanity. The 9 experts, who serve as Special Rapportuers appointed by the UN Human Rights Council in Geneva, warned that these acts could amount to sexual slavery, reproductive violence, enforced disappearance, torture, inhuman and degrading treatment and femicide. The group argued further that despite the disclosures in the reams of documents released by the US Justice Department, accountability had been limited. Sherwin Bryce-Pease reports.

For more news, visit sabcnews.com and #SABCNews on all Social Media platforms.

episodes.title: SA Epstein survivor details alleged abuse
episodes.description:
South African Julliette Bryant has opened about about her very first encounter with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein the in mid-2000's. 

She has detailed how she met him in Cape Town, along with former US president Bill Clinton. 

Bryant talks to us now about her three weeks encounter, she was in America, beginning her traumatic experiences with Epstein.

For more news, visit sabcnews.com and #SABCNews on all Social Media platforms.

episodes.title: Zimbabwean police arrest leader of suspected cult Ishmael Chokurongerwa
episodes.description:
Zimbabwean police have arrested leader of suspected cult Ishmael Chokurongerwa on allegations of child abuse and forced marriages.

Ishmael was arrested at one of his farm on the outskirts of the capital Harare along with four other leaders

For more news, visit sabcnews.com and #SABCNews on all Social Media platforms.
